tag.description: Registers the published package with the given tag, such that `npm install @` will install this version. By default, `npm publish` updates and `npm install` installs the `latest` tag. See `npm-dist-tag` for details about tags.

access.description: Tells the registry whether this package should be published as public or restricted. Only applies to scoped packages, which default to restricted. If you don’t have a paid account, you must publish with --access public to publish scoped packages.

otp.description: If you have two-factor authentication enabled in auth-and-writes mode then you can provide a code from your authenticator with this. If you don’t include this and you’re running from a TTY then you’ll be prompted.
